Avoid using the standard library time and date functions from "<time.h>" (C/C++)
Ensure exception objects are always caught by reference (C++)
Ensure Switch statements have at least 2 case clauses (C/C++)
All if … else if constructs shall be terminated with an else clause (C/C++)
Avoid flexible array members (C/C++)
Avoid throwing an exception object of pointer type (C++)
Avoid using '//' and  '/*' within comments (C/C++)
Avoid using 'signal.h' (C/C++)
Avoid anonymous namespaces in header files (C++)
Avoid non-void return type function without an explicit return of an expression (C/C++)
Avoid other than main(), namespace declarations and extern "C" declarations in the global namespace (C/C++)
Avoid using the unbounded functions of <cstring> library
Where multiple handlers are provided in a single try-catch statement or function-try-block, any ellipsis (catch-all) handler shall occur last.
Avoid using "sizeof" on expressions that contain side effects
Avoid using Octal constants or escape sequences (C/C++)
Do not override the standard library functions (C/C++)
Avoid throwing exceptions outside of main()
Ensure that there is at least one exception handler to catch-all otherwise unhandled exceptions in the main function(C++)
Avoid loops with floating point counter (C/C++)
Avoid testing floating point numbers for equality
Avoid doing assignments in sub-expressions (C++)
Avoid having  a method call or additional expressions in a statement using "++" or "--" operators (C/C++)
Avoid using Digraphs (C++)
Avoid using Trigraphs
Avoid using Unions
All constructors that are callable with a single argument of fundamental type shall be declared explicit.
Avoid declaring data members in non-POD classes as public or protected
A base class shall be declared virtual only if it is used in a diamond hierarchy
Avoid using C-style and functional notation casts (C++)
Handlers of a function-try-block implementation of a class constructor ordestructor shall not reference non-static members from this class or its bases.
Avoid performing conversion from a function pointer to any other type (C/C++)
Avoid casting and converting a pointer type to an integral type (C/C++)
Member functions shall not return non-const handles to class-data.
Avoid using 'enum' types as operands for arithmetic contexts
Avoid having boolean operators with non-boolean operands (C/C++)
Avoid having expressions with bool type to be used as operands on operators other than =, &&, ||, !, ==, !=, the unary & operator, and the conditional operator
Avoid dynamic_cast to convert current object to its derived class from its constructor or destructor
Avoid delete operators to exit with an exception.
Avoid move constructor and move assignment operator to exit with an exception
Never use SQL queries with a cartesian product (SQL)
Never use SQL queries with a cartesian product on XXL Tables (SQL)
Avoid non-indexed SQL queries
Avoid non-indexed XXL SQL queries
Avoid non-SARGable queries
Avoid NATURAL JOIN queries
Specify column names instead of column numbers in ORDER BY clauses
Avoid queries using old style join convention instead of ANSI-Standard joins (SQL)
Avoid Artifacts with too many parameters (SQL)
Avoid using the GROUP BY clause
Avoid using quoted identifiers
Avoid using dynamic SQL in SQL Artifacts
Always define column names when inserting values
Use MINUS or EXCEPT operator instead of NOT EXISTS and NOT IN subqueries
Avoid Artifacts with queries on too many Tables and/or Views
Avoid exists and not exists independent clauses (SQL)
DISTINCT should not be used in SQL SELECT statements
Use ANSI standard operators in SQL WHERE clauses
Replace OR conditions testing equality on the same identifier in SQL WHERE clauses by an IN test condition
Avoid empty catch blocks (SQL)
Table naming convention - character set control (SQL)
View naming convention - character set control (SQL)
Package naming convention - prefix control (SQL)
Package Function naming convention - prefix control (SQL)
Package Stored Procedure naming convention - prefix control (SQL)
Use WHEN OTHERS in exception management (SQL)
Never use WHEN OTHER THEN NULL
Avoid large Tables - too many columns (SQL)
Do not mix ANSI and non-ANSI JOIN syntax in the same query
LIKE operator should not start with a wildcard character
Use at most one statement per line (SQL)
Avoid cascading Triggers (SQL)
Avoid improperly written triangular joins with XXL tables
Avoid synonym with both private and public definition
Avoid explicit comparison with NULL
Tables should be aliased
Tables aliases should not end with a numeric suffix
Column references should be qualified
Prefer PRIVATE to PUBLIC synonym
Avoid orphaned synonyms
Avoid looping chain of synonyms
Avoid Cursors inside a loop (SQL)
VARCHAR2 and NVARCHAR2 should be used
LONG and LONG RAW datatypes should no longer be used
Each table should have a clustered index
Errors should be handled in stored procedures and functions
Stored Procedures should always RETURN a status value
Avoid SQL injection in dynamic SQL for Oracle
Avoid Artifacts with a Complex SELECT Clause (SQL)
Avoid Functions and Procedures doing an Insert, Update or Delete without managing a transaction (SQL)
Avoid using explain() in production code (JEE)
Avoid having multiple Artifacts updating data on the same NoSQL Collection (JEE)
Avoid having multiple Artifacts inserting data on the same NoSQL Collection (JEE)
Avoid having multiple artifacts deleting data on the same NoSQL collections (JEE)
Avoid artifacts having db.collection.ensureIndex() to create new indexes
When using compound indexes, avoid having different index ordering in collection access
Avoid having multiple Artifacts updating data on the same NoSQL Collection
Avoid having multiple Artifacts inserting data on the same NoSQL Collection
Avoid having multiple artifacts deleting data on the same NoSQL collection
Avoid string interpolations to prevent SQL injections (MyBatis/iBatis)
